result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kendrick Lamar Bell

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Representation by Attorney Sylvan Jaspen received and filed. bm
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for plea/sentencing. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued with REMAND TO JUDGE upon return of the bench warrant. Court took no action on bail.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Discharge Summary Report received and filed.  bm
Justice Point Pretrial Services Discharge Summary Report received and filed.  bm
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and forwarded to Judge for review.  nk

Defendant Kendrick L Bell appeared via Zoom.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared in court.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Defendant unable to appear in person due to positive COVID-19 test result.  Court rescheduled hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Kendrick Lamar Bell in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense counsel requests case to be transfered to Judge Shelton, Br. 40.  Court will allow case to be transfered for global resolution only.  Case adjourned, Br. 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Kendrick Lamar Bell in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Kendrick Lamar Bell in custody.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Defense has discovery and requests additional time to review.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kendrick Lamar Bell in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen; both appear by video.  Defendant Kendrick Lamar Bell in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared  in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Officer M. Klipp. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel received and filed.  bm

Court ordered no contact with E.I.O AND L.L.O
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Kendrick Lamar Bell in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Kendrick Lamar Bell in custody.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kendrick Lamar Bell appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
